fact: A day on Venus is longer than its year! Venus takes 243 Earth days to rotate once but only 225 Earth days to orbit the Sun.
Jupiter's Great Red Spot is a storm that has been raging for over 400 years and is so big that Earth could fit inside it.
Saturn's rings are made mostly of ice particles ranging from tiny grains to chunks as big as houses.
Neutron stars are so dense that a teaspoon of their material would weigh about 6 billion tons on Earth.
The Sun contains 99.86% of all mass in our solar system.
If you could drive a car at 60 mph straight up it would take about an hour to reach space.
Footprints on the Moon will last for millions of years because there is no wind or water to erode them.
There are more stars in the universe than grains of sand on all of Earth's beaches.
A year on Mercury is just 88 Earth days but a day on Mercury lasts 59 Earth days.
Mars has the largest volcano in the solar system called Olympus Mons which is about 13.6 miles high.
The coldest place in the known universe is the Boomerang Nebula at -458Â°F just one degree above absolute zero.
Astronauts grow up to 2 inches taller in space because there is no gravity compressing their spines.
One million Earths could fit inside the Sun.
The International Space Station travels at about 17500 mph completing one orbit around Earth every 90 minutes.
Neptune's winds are the fastest in the solar system reaching speeds of 1200 mph.
